intro: Melampyrum dentatum, commonly known as the toothed touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, toothed leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Melampyrum dentatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
